sentence: Gardens in the Bay Botanical Gardens Little India etc Nothing
Taxis in Singapore are great value for money so if you have children hail one down and travel to sentosa where you can find loads of entertainment and lovely beaches
Great location pity the sea is so far away these days

Superb facilities responsive personnel central to everything we wanted to experience in Singapore Close to Marina Bay excellent shopping malls easy access via taxi bus or MRT to all tourist activities
Sky cloud Jimbo restaurant botanical gardens orchid road marina bay sands

I made that mistake but on the positive side I went found the Singapore Art Museum which was a great find and nice cool escape from the heatFor us Singapore is not really a holiday destination as traditionally it is not a beach or surf holiday destination but rather a place for work or transit however we loved our stay so much that we would fly in especially just to stay at the Raffles again
Expensive but worth every penny and you can walk to the nearest shopping centre and last night we walked back from Marina bay lovely safe walk
Old feeling We have stayed in this area several times before so knew the transport system and the new Marina Bay
We walked from the Gardens by the Bay to Raffles which meant we had a good thirst up when we got there
On our return stretch we took a cab to Gardens by the bay it was gorgeous
Could not agree more with Martine P Arrived having dressed according to code to find others are served dressed in beach clothes

Crowded filled with Aussie and Kiwi tourists with no dress code like other Singapore high end hotels everyone looked like they just finished an exhausting mountain hike Room for several more chairs at the antique bar and finally damn expensive even for metro Singapore
Facing the front of the hotel is the Beach Road which at the time of its opening was called the beach house because it was by the sea

It runs off Beach Road parallel to Raffles BoulevardThe pop up is quite small and does not have the grand atmosphere of the Long Bar but the slings are good if pricyThere is also a shop attached selling Raffles branded items
Raffles was originally on the beach front and guests could saunter down for a swim and return
Now Singapore has reclaimed about 25 of its area and Raffles is no longer on the beachfront

so I will stay superficial and will just write a few words about the beauty of these old stones painted in white British colonial style massively anchored in the middle of Victoria Street Beach road and Raffles bld not as old as some Cambodian temples or Roman vestiges but as much iconic as them it is reputation not being established by the number of the years it has been built but more by the place it occupies in the short Singapore history

Inspired by an upcoming book by Pico Iyer the bar ’s first writer in residence the current cocktail menu includes the burdock centric and gin based Escape to Home to the savoury mildly spicy and tamarind intense Rojak Daron XO peanut calvados tamarind campari chilli gula melaka
I ordered sea bass which arrived strangely on a bed of boiled egg white and was about the size of a silver dollar
The buffet which I before considered the best Indian meal in SEA have been drastically reduced to 3 small tables cold hot and a small dessert table
